intro: Lorentea capillipes, commonly known as the slender hairroot plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white to pink flowers, which are often fragrant. Lorentea capillipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
